1.comment: Fred Jackson the most. Jackson caught 7 balls for 83 yards.

2.comment: Fred Jackson. In total, Zohan had 4 turnovers (3 picks, 3 fumbles). Otherwise, Zohan was 24-of-39 for 148 yards and a touchdown. He remains 1 of the worst anti-terrorist/quarterback hybrids in the NFL.    As mentioned, Lynch and Jackson ran well. Lynch totaled 127 yards on 21 carries. Jackson rushed for 31 yards and caught 6 balls for 24 more yards. He scored once on a very tough run in which he carried half a dozen defenders into the end zone.    Nothing from

3.comment: Fred Jackson moved out of the backfield and ran past everyone downfield. Jackson did everything for the Bills, gaining 43 rushing yards and 70 receiving yards. He also had a touchdown.

4.comment: Fred Jackson, getting all of the work because Marshawn Lynch was out, had a great game. He rushed for 136 yards on 27 attempts.    Having to throw as a result of trailing for 48 minutes,

5.comment: Fred Jackson is a stud. He rushed for 163 yards on 28 carries against Tampa Bay's anemic defense. At this point, it would be a huge error on Dick Jauron's part to give Marshawn Lynch the starting job once he returns from his suspension.

6.comment: Fred Jackson is a stud. He rushed for 163 yards on 28 carries against Tampa Bay's anemic defense. At this point, it would be a huge error on Dick Jauron's part to give Marshawn Lynch the starting job once he returns from his suspension.

7.comment: Fred Jackson, who rushed for 71 yards on 18 carries. He also caught 4 balls for 26 yards. Twenty-two touches for Jackson is clearly not enough; he's arguably the team's best offensive player and needs the rock in his hands as much as possible.

8.comment: Fred Jackson turned 15 touches into 47 total yards.    Congratulations to Owens, by the way, who had a season-high reception total. Owens grabbed 4 balls for 44 yards.

9.comment: Fred Jackson (15). Lynch's 19 carries went for 61 yards, while Jackson turned 15 rushes into 52 yards.    With Fitzpatrick under center,

10.comment: Fred Jackson did nothing (5 carries, 2 yards).    It's really amazing that the Panthers lost this game because Buffalo finished with 167 total net yards and only 9 first downs. As you might imagine, the man responsible was

11.comment: Fred Jackson had 9 carries each for 43 and 28 yards, respectively.    Congratulations to the Texans, who are now 5-3. This looked like a trap game, but Houston overcame an early deficit to win. This is the first time in the Texans' franchise history that they're 2 games over .500 (outside of a 2-0 start in 2007). It's also the first time ever that they've won a contest when favored on the road. Unfortunately, this victory for Houston comes with some unfortunate news. Daniels will be out for the rest of the year with what seems to be a torn ACL.

12.comment: Fred Jackson was Buffalo's best offensive player in this contest. He rushed for 48 yards on 8 carries and also had an impressive 27-yard touchdown pass to

13.comment: Fred Jackson, a much more talented player, gained 35 yards on 9 rushes and also had 4 catches for 20 more yards.    Forum member Leelee pointed out that Fewell's game plan was to have

14.comment: Fred Jackson was the star for the Bills. He rushed 15 times for 73 yards and 2 touchdowns, and also had 5 receptions for 43 more yards.

15.comment: Fred Jackson had 99 yards on 20 carries (as well as 3 receptions for 23 more yards).

16.comment: Fred Jackson helped keep the Bills in the game, rushing for 80 yards on 15 attempts. With Jackson's help, BUffalo actually outgained New England, 241-224 and won the time-of-possession battle by 7 minutes. Reed's dropped touchdown ended up being the deciding play.    Though the Patriots barely outplayed the Bills, let's just remember how many key players they were missing. They were down 2 defensive linemen (Vince Wilfork, Ty Warren) and 2 offensive linemen (Stephen Neal, Nick Kaczur). Also, Brady is definitely not himself, though there's no telling if he'll ever be close to 100 percent before the 2010 season. <div class=dfpAdSlots>

17.comment: Fred Jackson had 39 yards on 13 carries, including a fumble-six.

18.comment: Fred Jackson had 23 carries (73 yards). Spiller had just 7 (33 yards). Spiller, selected ninth overall, is barely being used. Meanwhile, Aaron Maybin, taken No. 11 overall a year before, was a healthy scratch. Perhaps, the Bills shouldn't even draft anyone to save themselves the embarrassment.    The Ravens ran the ball all over the Bills -

19.comment: Fred Jackson saw 20 carries (64 yards) to Spiller's 6 (17 yards). Spiller also had 4 receptions for 28 more yards.

20.comment: Fred Jackson did it all. It seemed like every 5 minutes, NFL.com would have a Big Play Alert highlighting a long Jackson gain. Jackson rushed for 133 yards on 25 carries, and also caught 6 balls for 37 receiving yards. He scored twice.    Hill once again posted great fantasy numbers. He went 29-of-50 for 323 yards, 1 touchdown and an interception. Those stats are a farce, however, as Hill was erratic all afternoon. He had some passes dropped, but should have also tossed a couple more picks.

21.comment: Fred Jackson, meanwhile, had 116 yards and 2 scores on 21 carries.

22.comment: Fred Jackson had a monstrous performance. He was OK on the ground (12-59), but did most of his damage as a receiver coming out of the backfield, catching 5 balls for 104 yards and a 65-yard score.    The Steelers ultimately won after the Johnson drop with a

23.comment: Fred Jackson (11-42) and Steve Johnson (2-36) both disappointed their fantasy owners.

24.comment: Fred Jackson gained 112 yards on 29 carries, while C.

25.comment: Fred Jackson handled most of the workload, rushing for 112 yards on 20 carries.

27.comment: Fred Jackson took advantage. He rushed for 111 yards and a touchdown on 26 carries. He was also effective in the passing game, catching 6 balls for 85 receiving yards. The Eagles also gave this game away with sloppy play on offense. QB Dog Killer went 26-of-40 for 315 yards and 2 touchdowns with 90 rushing yards. However, he also had 4 interceptions. Two of the picks weren't his fault. The first 1 was the result of a pass tipped at the line of scrimmage. The final interception occurred because the ball popped out of

28.comment: Fred Jackson breaking off an 80-yard touchdown run. He got excellent blocks from center

29.comment: Fred Jackson was a nightmare for Washington. He rushed for 120 yards on 26 carries and also caught 3 balls for 74 receiving yards.    This marked the first time that the Bills have covered the spread in Toronto. From the shots I saw from FOX's cameras, it looked like half the seats were empty. Great job screwing the great Buffalo fans out of another home game, Ralph.

30.comment: Fred Jackson was also guilty of a key give-away. Down just 6-0 at the beginning of the third quarter, he fumbled deep in his own territory, giving New York an easy touchdown drive. Given Buffalo's inability to move the chains - they had just 3 first downs up until that point - a 13-0 deficit was just too much for them to overcome.    As for the Jets, Mark Sanchez played pretty well aside from that aforementioned pick, though he nearly had a second interception prior to halftime. Sanchez finished 20-of-28, 230 yards, 1 touchdown and that pick.    Sanchez's touchdown went to

31.comment: Fred Jackson is still good. Despite getting only 13 carries, Jackson tallied 114 yards. His longest gain was 19, so it's not like this was all just 1 huge burst.

33.comment: Fred Jackson broke his leg. Well, he sprained his knee in this contest, so he'll probably be out for a while.

34.comment: Fred Jackson (13-29) never got going either.    Brady was 22-of-36 for 340 yards with 3 scores and no picks. Wes Welker caught 9 passes for 129 yards. Lloyd caught 3 for 50 with a garbage-time touchdown.    If you need a running back for your fantasy team, think of picking up Bolden. Ridley (22-106) and Bolden (16-137) were phenomenal against Buffalo. They both ran hard and dominated the Bills' linebackers.

36.comment: Fred Jackson fumbled in his own territory on the opening drive, which led to a field goal. Soon after, Kolb took a safety. Kolb also tossed a weird, side-armed throw into traffic for his pick and wasn't helped with an

37.comment: Fred Jackson (8 catches, 49 receiving yards), Steve Johnson (5-71) and Donald Jones (4-47).

39.comment: Fred Jackson fumbled twice, which is amusing because the Bills talked about giving C.

40.comment: Fred Jackson. Spiller (14-107) had almost double the carries compared to Jackson (6-16) and predictably was much more effective. Each had 1 catch.

41.comment: Fred Jackson actually had way more carries than C.

42.comment: Fred Jackson; it wasn't even close. Jackson mustered only 14 yards on 9 attempts, which included a lost fumble deep in St. Louis territory. Jackson ultimately suffered a knee injury that reportedly doesn't look good. I don't understand what the hell Gailey was thinking; his refusal to involve Spiller in this offense has cost his team multiple victories. It's bad enough to do it once or twice, but this has occurred at least half-a-dozen times already this season. He has to be axed because he clearly can't learn from his mistakes.    Despite holding a lead throughout, the Bills attempted 33 passes to just 16 runs. That's smart.

43.comment: Fred Jackson. The veteran back rushed for 67 yards on 13 carries and also hauled in 4 catches for 41 yards.    E.J. Manuel went 18-of-27 for 150 yards and 2 touchdowns in his debut. He made safe throws early on, but took more chances as the game progressed. It was disappointing to see him scramble just 3 times for 23 rushing yards. Running is his best trait, so he needs to do that much more.    Manuel's 2 scores went to Stevie Johnson (3-39) and

44.comment: Fred Jackson (12-30; 4-23) steal a touchdown from him at the goal line.    The Panthers ran the ball pretty well. They were able to move the chains down the field and set up what looked like a front-door field goal late in regulation.

45.comment: Fred Jackson's numbers look much better, as he rushed for 72 yards on 7 tries and caught 4 balls for 37 receiving yards. However, 59 of Jackson's 72 yards on the ground came on just 1 carry. Jackson also fumbled in the second half, but it of course was nullified by a New York penalty.

46.comment: Fred Jackson once again outgained him, registering 87 yards and a touchdown on 16 carries.    E.J. Manuel had a mixed game. He displayed accuracy issues at times and nearly lost a fumble while trying to run out the clock. He also threw 2 picks and had an earlier strip that eventually turned into a Baltimore touchdown. However, all of this was mixed in with several impressive throws to move the chains; Buffalo outgained the Ravens, 350-345. Manuel went 10-of-22 for 167 yards, 1 touchdown and the 2 interceptions. He threw what looked like a second score to

47.comment: Fred Jackson was the better player once again, rushing for 53 yards and 2 touchdowns on 17 attempts. He also caught 4 balls for 40 receiving yards.    It's hard to believe, but

48.comment: Fred Jackson split carries evenly, with each getting 10 totes. They accumulated 55 and 35 yards, respectively. Jackson also had 4 catches for 13 receiving yards.    As for the Bengals,

49.comment: Fred Jackson and Tashard Choice failed to even match Miller's yardage total.

50.comment: Fred Jackson tallied only 45 yards and a touchdown on 15 carries.    Lewis, as mentioned earlier, struggled early on. He had some quality attempts though and wasn't completely inept, finishing 22-of-39 for 234 yards, 1 touchdown and an interception. Lewis' sole score went to Stevie Johnson (7-72).

54.comment: Fred Jackson, meanwhile, found the end zone twice with his 42 rushing yards (11 carries) and 36 receiving yards (4 catches).    E.J. Manuel had a decent performance, though it probably should have been better considering his opponent. He went 18-of-32 for 210 yards and 2 touchdowns (1 passing, 1 rushing). Manuel appeared to suffer an injury in the first half on a play that saw Atlanta commit a roughing-the-passer penalty, but he obviously remained in the game.    I mentioned Johnson and Chandler as the 2 players who helped ruin a potential victory. They happened to lead the team in receiving; Johnson had 5 catches for 55 yards, while Chandler's 4 receptions went for 63 yards.    The Falcons struggled to move the chains early, mustering just 189 net yards of offense in the first half compared to 234 afterward.

55.comment: Fred Jackson (5-12 rushing, 4-26 receiving) was also contained.    The star of the game was David as he had 9 tackles with a sack and 2 interceptions. He was awesome.

57.comment: Fred Jackson had his first huge performance in quite a while, generating 111 yards and a touchdown on 19 carries.

63.comment: Fred Jackson sustained. He limped off in the second half, which spoiled a fantastic outing in which he rushed for 49 yards on 10 carries and logged 7 catches for 58 receiving yards. Fortunately, it was just a mild knee sprain.

64.comment: Fred Jackson, who was questionable heading into this contest, outgained him by a slim margin (10-26, TD).

73.comment: Fred Jackson fumbled at the very end when Wilson repeatedly kept dinking and dunking with almost no time available. They had no timeouts late because they squandered a pair earlier in the half. I'm sure there are other things as well that I'm missing. Regardless, the Seahawks need to get their act together before they fall too far behind the Cardinals in the divisional race.    Wilson finished 19-of-30 for 206 yards, 2 touchdowns and an interception. The good news is that he scrambled 10 times for 78 rushing yards. The bad news is Wilson didn't look as good as the passing stats indicate. Wilson, who was constantly under siege behind a poor offensive line, threw several inaccurate passes.
